questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following step of the scientific method comes before all the rest?
What do we call a scientist who specializes in studying insects?
To which one of the following organic molecules do enzymes belong?
Which of the following is a coenzyme?
Which of the following units of measurement is more convenient to express the size of cellular organelles?
Which tool of the biologist is more frequently used to study cell structure in the laboratory?
What colour do gram-positive bacteria stain with Gram's stain?
Which group of organisms in the ecosystem release nutrients locked up in dead bodies of organisms?
Which of the following are the two major constituents of eukaryotic chromosomes?
Which of the following behavioural biologists is known for his study about imprinting behaviour in animals?
Which group of animals has the highest numbers of total and endemic species in Ethiopia?
What is the molecule that supplies the quickest and suitable source of energy to cells?
A carbohydrate compound is known to have 12 carbon atoms in the whole molecule. What could this compound be?
Among the following organisms, which one belongs to the prokaryotes?
Which one of the following crops has its centre of origin and diversity in Ethiopia has become a leading international commodity of commerce?
Baby ostriches tend to follow the first moving object that they see as they hatch out of the eggs. What kind of animal behaviour does this demonstrate?
Which of the following is true about mutations that occur in normal body cells?
questionList.choiceA: They never lead to cancerous cells.
questionList.choiceB: They never pass to the next generation.
questionList.choiceC: They never damage the affected cells.
questionList.choiceD: There is no way that they kill the affected cells.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the process called when two bacteria directly contact cell to cell and exchange their genetic information?
Why is it that mutations are considered as one of the raw materials of evolution?
questionList.choiceA: They contribute to new variations in organisms.
questionList.choiceB: They are usually related to the environment in which they appear.
questionList.choiceC: They are mostly beneficial to the organism in which they appear.
questionList.choiceD: They usually become the causes for species extinction.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is consistent with the understanding of human evolution?
questionList.choiceA: Bipedalism was never important in human evolution.
questionList.choiceB: Larger brain size had no contribution to the evolution of the human species.
questionList.choiceC: Human ancestry had no relation whatsoever with that of the chimpanzees.
questionList.choiceD: Fossils of Lucy and Ardi provided evidence for human origin.

questionList.questionStatement: If certain food stuff gave a positive result with Benedict's test only after it was hydrolyzed with hydrochloric acid, which of the following substances could it be?
In scientific method, What is the importance of a background research for a given problem?
questionList.choiceC: To prepare report of the result

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about mitochondria and chloroplasts?
Which of the following molecules is NOT a polymer?
Which of the following is formulated as a possible outcome of an experiment?
Which of the following classes of molecules CANNOT pass easily across the cell membrane by simple diffusion?
Which of the following substances has a shape which is similar to that of the substrate of an enzyme?
At which level of structural organization do proteins have the alpha-helix shape?
Among the following scientists who contributed to the cell theory. Identify the one who stated that '<i>a cell can arise only from another cell like it
What does it mean when biologists express the cell membrane as a unit membrane?
questionList.choiceA: cell is covered by a single membrane.
questionList.choiceB: A membrane is only one lipid layer thick.
questionList.choiceC: All cells have essentially similar membrane.
questionList.choiceD: A membrane is covered by a single layer of protein.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following features makes human T-lymphocyte cells more vulnerable to HIV attack? Presence of:
Which one of the following terms refers to how fast an enzyme acts on its substrate?
Which of the following factors determines the rate at which organelles settle out of cell homogenate if spun in a centrifuge?
questionList.choiceB: Function of the organelle in the cell.
questionList.choiceC: Location of the organelle in the cell.
questionList.choiceD: Thickness of the membrane covering the organelle.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following classes of organic molecules is the least important source of energy for cellular respiration?
Which of the following modes of transport is used by cells to move substances against their concentration gradients?
Which of the following is NOT true about instinctive behaviour?
questionList.choiceA: It can be developed further through learning.
questionList.choiceB: It is triggered by a key stimulus.
questionList.choiceC: It has a fixed action pattern.
questionList.choiceD: It is adaptive for the species.

questionList.questionStatement: In which of the following ways do retroviruses differ from other RNA viruses?
questionList.choiceC: They copy RNA to DNA molecule.
questionList.choiceD: They copy RNA from DNA molecule.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following groups of micro-organisms does not contain parasitic members?
Which of the following is NOT the correct characteristic of tropical rainforests?
Which one of the following processes has a decreasing effect on the concentration of atmospheric carbon dioxide?
For what purpose do molecular biologists use the technology known as polymerase chain reaction or PCR?
questionList.choiceC: To multiply copies of DNA molecule.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the long term primary effect of the current tree planting activities that Ethiopia is undertaking?
questionList.choiceA: It will protect from harmful solar rays.
questionList.choiceB: It will increase the global temperature.
questionList.choiceC: It will reduce the atmospheric CO<sub>2</sub>.
questionList.choiceD: It will mend the holes in the ozone layer.

questionList.questionStatement: Suppose when you first enter a room you notice an unpleasant smell which you eventually forget about its presence, what is this behaviour called?
Which of the following is an evolutionary requirement for two sub-populations of a species to evolve into independent species?
From evolutionary point of view, which of the following animals is expected to have haemoglobin proteins that are least similar to that of human?
Which element is found in nucleic acids?
From where do plants get most of their nutrients?
What do you call a group of genetically identical plants produced by vegetative reproduction?
What is the base found in RNA in place of thymine of DNA?
What does a restriction enzyme do?
Which one of the following is the smallest of all?
What is the ultimate source of all scientific knowledge?
The optimum temperature of enzymes found in thermophilic bacteria is:
questionList.choiceA: lower than for enzymes in the human body.
questionList.choiceB: higher than enzymes in the human body.
questionList.choiceC: the same as enzymes found in human body.
questionList.choiceD: lower than enzymes found in warm blooded animals.

questionList.questionStatement: A cow was found to yield much higher milk than any of the breeds of the parental cattle. What could be the most probable reason for this?
The most complex structure of proteins is called
Which are the four most abundant elements in living cells?
When the F1 hybrid of a monohybrid cross is back crossed with the homozygous recessive parent, what percentage of the offspring would be homozygous recessive?
Which of the following is an inorganic molecule?
Which of the following expression is more related to the phrase survival of the fittest?
In the formation of a macromolecule, what type of reaction would join two subunits together?
What did Francesco Redi prove through his scientific experiment?
questionList.choiceA: Maggots appear spontaneously on foods placed anywhere.
questionList.choiceB: Maggots do not appear in foods kept in jars that are protected with a cover.
questionList.choiceC: Maggots do not appear in foods kept in open jars.
questionList.choiceD: Flies appear spontaneously on rotting meat kept in closed or open jars alike.

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following shows the feeding method of decomposers?
What happens when the carrying capacity of an ecosystem is reached?
questionList.choiceA: Excretory product accumulates and population numbers increase.
questionList.choiceC: Population numbers remain more or less constant.
questionList.choiceD: Resources are plentiful and populations shoot up.

questionList.questionStatement: In which industrial products is pyruvate fermentation by yeast practically applied?
To which group of organic compounds do the triglycerides and waxes belong?
What does an ethologist study?
Which one the following is a biotic factor operating within an ecosystem?
questionList.choiceA: The amount of helium gas in the air
questionList.choiceB: The rate of flow of water in a river
questionList.choiceC: The carnivores that consume other animals
questionList.choiceD: The type of climate in a given region

questionList.questionStatement: When athletes take part in short distance running, how do the cells generate most of the energy that is quickly needed?
What do you call the reasoning technique in science where general principles are used to analyse specific cases?
If a substance that weighs 2,000 grams and has a half-life of 100 years is left with only 250 grams, for how long has the radioactive decaying activity been undergoing?
Which of the following will primarily happen if the enzymes in the lysosomes of a cell are defective?
questionList.choiceA: Cellular debris will not be removed

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about all proteins?
questionList.choiceA: They are twenty amino acids long.
questionList.choiceD: The monomers are held together by peptide bonds.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the properties of water allows mosquito larvae to hung themselves dawn into the water from the water surface?
questionList.choiceB: Its high latent heat of vaporization
questionList.choiceD: Its low density in solid state

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following properties of enzymes makes it possible that a single enzyme molecule can act on many substrate molecules?
questionList.choiceB: Enzymes lower the energy of activation
questionList.choiceC: Enzymes are reused over and over again

questionList.questionStatement: If the rate of an enzyme catalysed reaction remains constant even when more substrate is added to the reaction, which of the following might be the reason?
questionList.choiceD: Loss of substrate specificity by the enzyme

questionList.questionStatement: Which stage in the life cycle of HIV is disrupted if AIDS patients are treated with a drug that has a protease inhibiting activity?
questionList.choiceA: Entry of the virus into the host.
questionList.choiceB: Conversion of viral RNA to DNA.
questionList.choiceC: Integration of viral DNA into host DNA.
questionList.choiceD: Assembly of viral parts into whole virus.

questionList.questionStatement: Of the following four cells whose surface area to volume ratio is given, which cell can more efficiently transport its needs of materials across the cell surface?
Cells immediately use the energy that electrons lose as they pass along the chain of electron carriers to:
questionList.choiceC: spin the rotor of ATP synthase

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a routine method used by clinics to test people for HIV infection?
questionList.choiceB: Counting the number of white blood cells.

questionList.questionStatement: The T-lymphocyte cells of AIDS patients are destroyed by:
questionList.choiceA: multiplication of HIV inside the cell
questionList.choiceC: the immune system of the host organism itself
questionList.choiceD: the CD4 receptors on the cell surface

questionList.questionStatement: Suppose a fossil initially contains 100,000 atoms of a certain radioactive element whose half life is 10,000 years, after how many years would the number of the atoms be 12500?

The following are Simpsom's index of species diversity calculated for four areas containing the same types of species. Which index value is from the area dominated relatively by a fewer number of species?
Which of the following happens in both cyclic and non-cyclic photophosphorilation?
Which of the following is NOT a tree characteristic of the populations of most the developing countries of the world?
questionList.choiceC: More number of old people than young people
questionList.choiceD: Birth rate greater than mortality rate

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is NOT true about the nature of the first form of organisms on earth? They were:
Choose the step that comes at the last step in the scientific method.
Which of the following is NOT true about C4 plants such as tef(Eragrostis tef)?
questionList.choiceA: CO<sub>2</sub> is harvested during the night tire
questionList.choiceB: The bundle sheath cells contain chloroplasts.
questionList.choiceC: Light-dependent reaction occurs in mesophyll cells.
questionList.choiceD: Chloroplasts of bundle sheath cells lack thylakoids.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the reason that plants do not use nitrogen directly from the atmosphere
questionList.choiceA: Nitrogen concentration is low in the atmosphere.
questionList.choiceB: The molecular size of nitrogen is too large to pass through the stomata
questionList.choiceC: Nitrogen can enter plants only through the root hairs.
questionList.choiceD: Plants lack the necessary process to use elementary nitrogen.

questionList.questionStatement: What does the fermentation of glucose by yeast normally yield?
Which of the following came first in the course of organic evolution ?
Which two nitrogenous bases belong to the purines?
Which of the following is true?
questionList.choiceA: Recessive alleles are only expressed in the homogygote.
questionList.choiceB: Dominant alleles are expressed only in the heterozygote.
questionList.choiceC: Recessive alleles are expressed in the heterozygote.
questionList.choiceD: Genetically modified organisms are never used to manufacture vaccines.

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is a functional group of a fatty acid?
Which one of the following is an example of an orientational innate behaviour?
questionList.choiceC: Sudden withdrawal of limbs from hot object

questionList.questionStatement: Which hormone promotes human sleepfulness in darkness and controls the sleep-wake cycle?
In Pavlov's experiment on the classical conditioning of dogs, what does the reaction of the dogs to the sound of the bell represent?
What is the purpose of the infoldings of the inner-membrane of the mitochondrion?
questionList.choiceA: Increasing the photosynthetic capacity of the cell.
questionList.choiceB: Speeding up the loss of CO<sub>2</sub> during fermentation.
questionList.choiceC: Speeding up the process of glycolysis.
questionList.choiceD: Increasing the surface area for ATP production.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a worthwhile biological problem for scientific investigation?
questionList.choiceA: Estimation of the amount of carbon in a forest ecosystem.
questionList.choiceB: How a crying dog can tell who among elders of the Village is going to die next.
questionList.choiceC: How witchcrafts inflict bad health by cursing a healthy person
questionList.choiceD: How the traditional medicine men/women cure a possessed person.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following biomes of the Earth has the greatest diversity of species?
One of the following is true about bacteriophages that have lysogenic life cycle.
questionList.choiceB: They integrate their nucleic acid in to that of the host
questionList.choiceC: They multiply in the host immediately after infection
questionList.choiceD: Progeny Viruses are released by chronic release method
